string_table:
#include "textus\string_table_amk_metka.xml" #include "textus\string_table_vergas.xml" Some kind of experimental device. It looks very similar to a car starter battery. Something resembling a battery A bit of cash Cash in old Soviet bills. Used as a monetary equivalent for small transactions between stalkers... "Hunter's" sausage Hunters have learned how to prepare a rather good sausage from certain animals of the Zone. It is very filling and practically never spoils... As for the taste... Well, we aren't exactly gourmets here... Box of matches Matches are an essential item in the Zone. Must be kept away from moisture... Simple lock A small lock that keeps a box from opening accidentally. Wad of cash Money meant for Borov. Anti-radiation drugs Heavy stalker equipment Light stalker equipment Medium stalker equipment Bandage Sleeping pills Help you fall asleep quickly. Negate the effects of energy drinks. Binoculars Bread Detailed map of the regional center Regional center map "Tourist's Delight" "Canned Beef" Anomaly detector Dosimeter Anomaly detector Elite anomaly detector Devices and gadgets PDA Flashlight Toolbox An ordinary toolbox. An indispensable item for storing repair kits and various supplies for field repairs of weapons and equipment. Weapon accessory kit Contains everything necessary for a deep modernization of the FN FAL rifle. Protective suit. Weight - 18 kg. Features: protects the body from "Fruit Punch", "Burnt Fuzz", most anomalies, and mechanical damage. The chest and back are protected by built-in bimetallic plates. Equipped with a sealed metal-plastic helmet and two oxygen tanks. Warning: with prolonged use, it wears out quickly, gets damaged, and tears. Protective suit. Weight - 8 kg. Features: protects the body from the effects of weak anomalies and mechanical damage. Equipped with an oxygen mask. Warning: with prolonged use, it wears out quickly, gets damaged, and tears. Protective suit. Weight - 12 kg. Features: protects the body from "Fruit Punch", "Burnt Fuzz", many anomalies, and mechanical damage. Equipped with a sealed helmet and an oxygen tank. Warning: with prolonged use, it wears out quickly, gets damaged, and tears. Red protective suit with a sealed helmet. Weight - 11 kg. Features: protects the body from fire, acids, gases, the effects of various anomalies, "Burnt Fuzz", and mechanical damage. Equipped with two oxygen tanks. Warning: with prolonged use, it wears out quickly, gets damaged, and tears. Army portable binoculars.
A Personal Digital Assistant (PDA) is an indispensable device in the Zone. A flashlight with a fairly powerful bulb. A very useful thing in low-light conditions. A flashlight with a fairly powerful bulb. Thanks to an improved charger, the battery charging time has been reduced. Energy drink "S.T.A.L.K.E.R.". Contains caffeine, taurine, and a powerful vitamin complex that relieves fatigue and adds strength. Helps to ward off sleepiness for a while when you feel like hitting the sack.
Unknown object. The label says it's beer.
It's unknown who manages to bake loaves in the Zone, but this bread isn't irradiated and is quite edible. In any case, no stalkers have complained yet. Canned food from an army supply warehouse looted by stalkers. The expiration date doesn't seem to have passed yet. Canned food sold by Sidorovich's competitor. The stamps on the tin seem fine, but better let the old man check for himself what's what regarding the quality. Often, for lack of anything better, this sausage—a mixture of chicken and soy substitute, is a stalker's breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Vodka produced by the "GSC" company. Goes down well and noticeably reduces the effects of radiation, but it should not be abused. Reduces the impact of radiation on the body. Dressing material. Helps stop bleeding. Universal medical kit. Allows dealing with injuries of various types and degrees of complexity: wounds, burns, and poisoning. Specialized medical kit for dealing with physical damage and bleeding. It includes components to accelerate blood clotting, painkillers, antibiotics, and immune stimulants. All drugs are packed in lead-lined mini-containers. Medical kit developed specifically for working in the Zone's conditions. The contents are selected both for treating wounds and for removing radionuclides from the body. It prevents the development of radiation sickness and reduces the accumulated radiation dose. Inside are pills, vials, tubes, and a plastic half-liter container with some kind of liquid. Label: "Use rectally for faster action." Energy drink "S.T.A.L.K.E.R." Beer of unknown origin Beer of unknown origin Colloidal gas cylinder Colloidal gas cylinder Colloidal gas was supplied to research laboratories for experiments—which ones specifically is now unknown. It is only known that the contents of the cylinders are extremely chemically active, explosive, and poisonous. Gasoline canister Canister Gasoline canister Energy drink "S.T.A.L.K.E.R." Equipment and food Food products "Everyday" sausage Rations Individual Combat Ration IRP-B Medical drugs First aid kit Army medkit Scientific medkit Scientific EXP-4 Vodka "Cossacks" Radio Guitar A six-string musical instrument. In skilled hands, it can quickly decorate any stalker's suit with a fancy "Spanish collar."
Dosimeter Anomaly detector Universal anomaly detector Improved anomaly detector "Fruit Punch" detector EAD - M1 EAD - M2 Measures the dose or power of ionizing radiation. To operate, it must be activated by placing the device on a belt or in a pocket on the rig. A device that detects the presence of certain types of anomaly fields and reports them with an audio signal of varying intensity depending on the distance to the object. Has a built-in Geiger counter. To operate, it must be activated by placing the device on a belt or in a pocket on the rig. This device was invented by scientists in the Zone. It detects the presence of most types of anomaly fields, reporting them with an audio signal of varying intensity depending on the distance to the object. It can also visually display the location of anomalies on the map. Has a built-in Geiger counter. To operate, it must be activated by placing the device on a belt or in a pocket on the rig. A device made on the basis of a universal detector that determines the presence of almost all types of anomalies, including the "Fruit Punch" so hated by all stalkers, and reports them with an audio signal of varying intensity depending on the distance to the object. As in the original model, there is a map output capability. A Geiger counter is also included. To operate, it must be activated by placing the device on a belt or in a pocket on the rig. A crudely assembled device for detecting "Fruit Punch" type anomalies. Alerts to the detection of an object using audio signals of varying intensity depending on the distance. Has a built-in Geiger counter. To operate, it must be activated by placing the device on a belt or in a pocket on the rig. "Experimental Artifact Detector, Model 1".
Theoretically, it determines the presence of "natural" artifacts of any kind within a radius of about 30 meters. It alerts the operator with an audio signal, the intensity of which changes depending on the distance to the target. Also has a built-in Geiger counter.
Not designed for belt-wear. Simultaneous activation with other working detector devices may distort the instrument's readings. "Experimental Artifact Detector, Model 2".
A gift from Gluzov. Unlike the previous model, this device is equipped with a screen that displays all detected artifacts, which significantly facilitates the search. Furthermore, the device now reacts not only to natural artifacts, but also to those of artificial origin that are not stored in containers, backpacks, or other objects shielding them from scanning. Like the first model, in passive mode the device emits an audio signal signaling the detection of an artifact nearby.
Simultaneous activation with other working detector devices may distort the instrument's readings.
Smoke grenade "Cat's Eye" drug The unique "Cat's Eye" drug, developed by scientific staff within the CEZ, allows for a temporary sharpening of vision in low-light environments. It has gained value among diggers and fans of night raids. Photograph The photograph captures two people. One of them painfully reminds you of someone familiar. "Eternal" fan Another unexplained phenomenon of the Zone. A fan that works without power! Collectors would pay big money for such a thing. Power battery Rechargeable battery. Very high capacity and reliable. In the Zone, it is used as a power element for radio stations and other devices. Rechargeable battery Rechargeable battery. Very high capacity and reliable. In the Zone, it is used as a power element for stimulating artifacts on a belt mount. Rechargeable battery. Completely discharged. Pack of AA batteries. A night in the Zone is something terrible. And to make it less creepy, many stalkers use headlamps. That's why traders bring in these batteries. Klyk Unique Device Klyk, a legendary mechanic of the Zone, invented and improved many things. What this particular device does is not reliably known, but like all unique things, it can be a collector's item. Protective psy-helmet This psy-helmet belonged to the legendary Strelok! Thanks to the protective properties of this helmet, Strelok visited the very heart of the Zone. Protective psy-helmet This protective helmet is tuned to shield the very weak psy-radiation of Agroprom and is intended for Klyk. A protective helmet, possibly capable of shielding against the psy-radiation of the "Brain Scorcher".
Shtyr's note Hey! It's Shtyr. Stopped by Yantar on business. Well, Sakharov said you'd be here soon too. Decided to drop you a line. The Professor said he'd give it to you when you show up.
Well, first about our business ... 
...
 Oh! By the way! Sakharov says you're planning to crawl into some lab with Vasilyev? And Ghost is with you? Here's the thing: the other day I saw Guide at the Cordon, he's waiting for someone there. He had a photo with Ghost, Strelok, and a couple of other people. I think I know one of them, but I can't remember for the life of me, so ask Ghost when you get a chance who they're with. I have my suspicions...
Well, take care. See ya. I'm heading off to Limansk, and then we'll see what happens... Post-mortem recording Greetings to you, human... This is a post-mortem message from me, a simple researcher of the Zone's secrets. I know that I will die soon. It's strange to stay calm at a time like this, but so it is.
I will describe everything that happened. To pass the time. To distract myself from thoughts of what awaits me.
Our Research Institute received information that here, in the exclusion zone, phenomena are observed that could disprove the theory of relativity regarding the constancy of the direction of time. The Guide we were recommended assured the management that he knew a practically safe path to the place where this anomaly is observed.
Strangely enough, we got here with the same group we started with. Ghost—that was the guide's name—really knew his business. Ghost. What pushed him to do this? Why? Was it all for the sake of the new emitter we received before leaving to test in field conditions?
I don't know. I'll tell you what I saw.
We got here at dusk. We settled near this strange unit; it reminded me of something painfully familiar. But what? I decided to record the day's impressions and moved away from the overly noisy group of our escort behind this structure. Out of the corner of my eye, I saw Ghost pull an artifact out of his backpack that he got from one of the stalkers we met. He did something with it, the artifact lit up... Then I got distracted, it seemed to me that one of the panels of the metal structure I was near had flipped open. That's what saved me... Saved... It sounds like a mockery now. A bright light illuminated everything around. There were no screams. In fact, it was very quiet. I passed out, probably. Probably. Otherwise, I cannot explain the fact that in the next second it was already day, the sun was shining. I had no records or weapons with me.
There was no pain either. And there isn't. But I can no longer feel anything below the waist. And the numbness is gradually rising higher. Apparently, the metal-like alloy of this structure shielded whatever caused this paralysis. Another oddity. I can still move my hands for now. I'll try to crawl to that container with the artifact I bartered from a trader in Limansk. He claimed that with its help, one could move through space... Stupid, of course. But what else is left... I'll try.
If it doesn't work, then... Why did Ghost need this? Why? Note from Kruglov Professor Kruglov, in his note, describes the situation in which a group of scientists found themselves in the Wild Territory and asks Sakharov to send a rescue helicopter. VHF radio Very High Frequency radio. Mainly serves for communication over short distances and providing calls to state rescue forces. Radio frequency scanner A homemade device assembled by a techie working for Borov. It allows for the automatic collection of information about all PDAs on the network within a small radius of the scanning point and transmits it to the recipient via a dedicated channel. Pouch
